p: Sesquiterpenes, especially sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (54.7–62.2%), dominated in both essential oils ( Table 1). However, in SGR essential oil, aplotaxene ( all- cis-heptadeca-1,8,11,14-tetraene) was the main constituent (27.3%). Among the sesquiterpenes, nardosina-1(10),11-diene was identified as the most dominant compound (20.7%) in this essential oil according to its mass spectrum and retention index [ 15]. The second significant sesquiterpene was dauca-4(11),8-diene (10.2%) whose MS was identical with literature data, and its RI on the Rtx-1 column differed from the RI available on DB-5 column [ 16]. In addition, petasitene (4.3%) and trans- α-bergamotene (4.2%) were presented in appreciable amounts in SGR essential oil ( Table 1).
